title: Quirky Headline Serif
content: I'm looking to pair up Meta with a sort of "quirky" serif. I plan to use the serif as headline and not body copy so I need something that will grab your attention in a fun, laid back way. Scala looks interesting but anyone know of others? Thanks.
author: •Prakash Nair

comments.content:
[FF Danubia](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11341.0.0)  
 [Zingha](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FB.120128.0.0)  
 [FF Oneleigh](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11099.0.0)  
or if you want to get _really_ crazy: [FF Fontesque](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.8503.0.0)

I'd recommend something from [Psy Ops](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.psyops.com/html/specimens.html)

maybe  
 [Aquamarine Titling](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_aquamarine.html)  
 [Oxtail](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_oxtail.html)  
or even  
 [Eidetic Neo](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/www.psyops.com/html/spec_eideticneo.html)

Maybe something from Caketype!

Actually what I was thinking of is in progress or private use.

What about Ronnia or Legato? They have a very nice heft to them in bold. Legato has a warm couchy feeling, Ronnia feels a bit more aspirational and is more cocktail-y.

Tiptoe has a great flow and I think t would play nice with Meta  
: [http://vllg.com/KLTF/Tiptoe/mudTyper+Weights/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014013511/http:/vllg.com/KLTF/Tiptoe/mudTyper+Weights/ "http://vllg.com/KLTF/Tiptoe/mudTyper+Weights/")
